meanings.definition: To set a new price for something.
meanings.sent1: The store repriced the old inventory to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: The company repriced their products to stay competitive in the market.
meanings.sent3: The magician repriced his tricks for a special show.
meanings.sent4: She repriced her artwork, hoping to spark more interest.
meanings.sent5: The chef repriced the menu items to reflect the quality of ingredients used.

meanings.definition: To adjust the price of something.
meanings.sent1: The airline repriced the tickets due to high demand.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore repriced the books during the clearance sale.
meanings.sent3: The students repriced their lemonade stand after realizing they undercharged.
meanings.sent4: The real estate agent repriced the house after renovations were completed.
meanings.sent5: The farmer repriced the produce based on the season's harvest.
